Description: Male figure cut out of a thin sheet of leather. One arm is missing; the figure has no feet.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: John de Monins Johnson
Curator's comments: The coarse contours suggests it was made as a doodle rather than by an experienced craftsman. Depicted in Griffith Institute Archive J. de M. Johnson excavation photograph (O’Connell forthcoming, fig. 122). O’Connell, Elisabeth R. Forthcoming. John de Monins Johnson’s 1913/14 Egypt Exploration Fund expedition to Antinoupolis (Antinoë), with appendix of objects, in Antinoupolis II: Scavi e materiali III, ed. R. Pintaudi. Florence: Istituto papirologico “G. Vitelli.”
Bibliographic references: O'Connell et al 2014 / Antinoupolis at the British Museum (31)
